DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Diagnostic Surgery Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies the surgical procedure(s) performed in an effort to diagnose and/or stage disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Surgical procedure(s) performed in an effort to diagnose and/or stage disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease).:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease)._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment:  See NAACCR Data Dicionary, Eleventh Edition, for coding instructions.]

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A procedure was done, but the type of procedure is unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A procedure was done, but the type of procedure is unknown.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure was done, but the type of procedure is unknown.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A bypass procedure was performed, and a biopsy of either the primary site or another site was done.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A bypass procedure was performed, and a biopsy of either the primary site or another site was done.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bypass procedure was performed, and a biopsy of either the primary site or another site was done.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No information about whether a diagnostic or staging procedure was performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No information about whether a diagnostic or staging procedure was performed.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No information about whether a diagnostic or staging procedure was performed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: An exploratory procedure was performed, and a biopsy of either the primary site or another site was done.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: An exploratory procedure was performed, and a biopsy of either the primary site or another site was done.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An exploratory procedure was performed, and a biopsy of either the primary site or another site was done.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A surgical procedure with a bypass was performed, but no biopsy was done.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A surgical procedure with a bypass was performed, but no biopsy was done.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure with a bypass was performed, but no biopsy was done.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A surgical exploratory only. The patient was not biopsied or treated.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A surgical exploratory only. The patient was not biopsied or treated.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical exploratory only. The patient was not biopsied or treated.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A biopsy (incisional, needle, or aspiration) was done of the primary site.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A biopsy (incisional, needle, or aspiration) was done of the primary site.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A biopsy (incisional, needle, or aspiration) was done of the primary site.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: A biopsy (incisional, needle, or aspiration) was done to a site other than the primary site. No exploratory procedure was done.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: A biopsy (incisional, needle, or aspiration) was done to a site other than the primary site. No exploratory procedure was done.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A biopsy (incisional, needle, or aspiration) was done to a site other than the primary site. No exploratory procedure was done.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No surgical diagnostic or staging procedure was performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No surgical diagnostic or staging procedure was performed.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No surgical diagnostic or staging procedure was performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease).:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Characteristic or indicative of a condition.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: FORDS Manual, Revised 2009
ReferenceDocuments.description: See FORDS Manual for specifications of codes and data entry rules.

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Summ--DX/STG Proc Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: For tumors diagnosed between 1996 and 2002 this field may have described palliative care. For tumors diagnosed on or after January 1, 2003 palliative care is coded in a new field RX Summ--Palliative Proc [3270].

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR V11.3 Data Stds/Dict.
